results.title: Care of the teeth
results.brief_description: The care of the teeth described in detail, showing approved methods of cleaning etc. Shows where decay starts, effect of abscesses, cause of narrow dental arches, fever teeth, straightening teeth and dental floss.

results.title: Care of the patient with Diabetes Mellitus (Uncomplicated)
results.creator_credit: F.E. Brooker and United States. Office of Education
results.brief_description: Uses a typical case history to show how symptoms of diabetes may be recognised. Preceding with consultation, examination, and diagnosis, the film then follows the patient through stages in treatment at the hospital. A nurse teaches a patient how to administer insulin injections, regulate diet, and make the Benedict test for sugar in the urine.

results.title: Care of the patient with diabetes mellitus (complicated)
results.brief_description: Shows the nurses’ role in the diagnosis and treatment of coma and insulin shock, and the role of the nurse, doctor, dietitian, and psychiatrist in assisting the patient to develop a healthy mental attitude towards his condition.

results.title: Care and maintenance of building plant
results.creator_credit: John Rhodes, John Taylor and Basic Films
results.brief_description: The film emphasises the necessity for conserving resources by maintaining plant at a high level of efficiency. Examples of neglect and some of the major repair work required because of the neglect of day-to-day maintenance are shown. The need for operators to realise their responsibility for keeping a machine in order is stressed. While every machine has its own maintenance routine, the simple rules common to all machines are demonstrated.

results.title: Cardiopulmonary resuscitation
results.brief_description: A refresher course for people with First Aid training on cardiopulmonary resuscitation. An excellent resource for Occupational Health and Safety Officers which demonstrates in clear and concise steps, the correct procedures for cardiopulmonary resuscitation on an adult. There is a simulated workplace accident which highlights the importance of following correct procedures. Many of the techniques are demonstrated by the use of a resuscitation dummy.

results.title: Carbon content
results.creator_credit: Robin Cantelon, Frank A. Hoare and British Iron and Steel Federation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Structure and Properties of Steel”.
In steel, carbon exists as a chemical compound with iron, known as cementite. The distribution of cementite and ferrite, or pure iron, governs grain structure. The film shows how this distribution is affected when the steel is heated and cooled

results.title: Carbon-dioxide absorption technique
results.brief_description: Explains the principles of CO2, absorption techniques, and demonstrates two methods in use: Single-phase absorption and closed circuit or double-phase absorption.

results.title: Carbon
results.creator_credit: Peter De Normanville and Anthony Gilkison Associates
results.brief_description: Shows the various forms of carbon and the familiar uses of such substances as diamond, pencil lead and charcoal. Surveys the everyday uses of carbon, both in the house and in industry, and touches on the development of pyrographite and carbon fibres. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: Caravan park
results.brief_description: Caravan Park is filmed both from the point of view of a small child and from an observer. A family of three is stranded in a caravan park when their car breaks down on the road home. A stray cat found near the car is taken as a good luck sign by the father and adopted by his son. As the family continues to struggle to make ends meet and get back on the road, the cat continues to be a sign of good luck for the father, until it dies. This is a slow paced narrative and requires careful examination of the characters to understand its purpose.

results.title: Captivated
results.creator_credit: David Squire, Piers Piers Godden and Dangerous to Know
results.brief_description: Written and performed by Rikki Beadle Blair, “Captivated” is a one-man theatre piece that tells the story of Shane, a gay black man imprisoned for murder. The monotony of his daily routine is broken by letters from a “pink” pen pal, a gay Asian man who writes to Shane as an act of charity. Their correspondence charts Shane’s personal journey from self-hatred, which has manifested in a personal history of violence, to agonised self-reflection, and finally a new found gratitude and respect for his unseen friend. Dynamically staged and produced, with a bravura performance of isolation and redemption by Blair, an award-winning actor and writer on British TV.
